performances.venue: Old Renaissance Faire Grounds Veneta, OR
performances.description: I've Never heard Jerry play this fast in any other one. Classic version, even more classic show.
One of the first versions of any dead song to hook me.  On point Euro '72 style
A ripper for sure...8-4 and 8-5 are here, but the best (this one) isn't? What are we doing here?
One of the best versions I have ever heard. Give it a listen! Crazy Good.
Classic version from a classic show.

performances.venue: Uni Dome, U of Northern Iowa Cedar Falls, IA
performances.description: crispy
Interplay between Jerry and Brent and the Phil bombs stand out for me.

performances.venue: Fillmore East New York City, NY
performances.description: epic Skull & Roses version.

performances.venue: Evans Field House, Northern Illinois University Dekalb, Il
performances.description: Sweet bass drop-ins by Phil on intro; extended Garcia solos in bridge jam; very intense and fun
Spot On
Pretty sick version here.  Middle jam is super hot.
I really dig the Pig + Keith action...I dunno there's something about this show that I love...
Surprised this isn't already here...Jerry is all over it and the crowd just eats it up
great bertha in a year of great berthas
A rocking version.

performances.venue: Cotterell Gym - Colgate University Hamilton, NY
performances.description: Super charged Bertha!
Firey
Bouncy version
a great start to a great show...
Breakneck version with an extra spicy solo
Kickoff to an epic show. Pig's organ, Billy's drumming, Kieth are all high points, not to mention the usual fine work from "the other ones"
Great Version of a Great Song, from a Great Month in '77
Super high energy version!

performances.venue: New Haven Coliseum New Haven, CT
performances.description: Slow and thunderous, it rumbles along joyfully.
Dick's Picks 20 version
Rippin'

performances.venue: Adams Field House, U of Montana Missoula, MT
performances.description: High energy to get the night going strong!
Give it a listen.  Actually think its better than all the great 1977 versions.
You know this was going to be a good night with a smokin Promised land>Bertha.
Smokin' opener. Mid song solo is potentially flawless, and the whole band is working together great.

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: Awesome Bertha>Jam>China Doll.

performances.venue: The Austin Municipal Auditorium Austin, TX
performances.description: Keith ... Road Trips ... awesome high energy ... if you please, I am on my bended knees, listen to this LOUD
Lopes along with a quality I can't quite my finger on...weir seems to be on point, and Keith really shines in this show
Playin>Bertha<Estimated>GDTRFB......Born too late, Crap! Oh Well!!!!!

performances.venue: Iowa Fieldhouse - University of Iowa Iowa City, IA
performances.description: A real smoker
nice opener in Europe
Rippingly good early version with Keith way out front. Jerry and the whole crew rock it hard!
smmoooooth as butter
Great version and real underated show.  Bob throws in some China Cat licks.  Overall, just a real cool vibe with this Bertha.
I can't believe I get to submit this.  Excellent start to this epic night.  Jer throws in cool riffs as he sings and then just nails the last jam.
Love the double opener, typically great playing from the time. Keith fans esp. should know this Palladium run.
Phil throws in some hypnotizing bass lines
Clean lines and cool fuzz work from Weir.
Powerful rocking opener, standard for the era but this version is given extra special attention.

performances.venue: William and Mary College Hall Williamsburg, VA
performances.description: Kicks of the '78 Dew set in style

performances.venue: McArthur Court, U of Oregon Eugene, OR
performances.description: Amazing. Give this a listen now!!!
Killer Bertha>GL to open.  Jerry's tone is bright and this one is super tight!
Super Speed Bertha!
A heavy version from a heavy show.
double opener. Nice melodic lead from Jerry, nice interplay with Keith.
Solid!
As sweet and solid as they come: Opens a wonderful summer outdoor show in NYC. Surprised it isn't here yet.

performances.venue: St. Louis Arena St. Louis, MO
performances.description: Crisp clean version to start off this great show!
real cool bertha opener from a real cool show
This is terriffic whole show is a keeper, great stuff, Phil on full out assault.

performances.venue: Barton Hall - Cornell University Ithaca, NY
performances.description: A standout version from a great show.
I love what Phil does on this one. This thing is short and sweet.
One of my favourite Jerry solos ever. The way he pulls off on the riff make for one of the funkiest Berthas ever. Climaxes around 4:20 too. Perfection
Up-tempo, bouncy flow

performances.venue: Academy of Music New York, NY
performances.description: Huge Bertha to start the night off!
Kicks off one hell of a grateful dead show. summer 73
Boys are dialed in
Awesome version, Jerry has a cool feedback/sustain part during the solo that just gets me every time. Segues into a killer GSET.
Smokin' Bucket>Bertha!
nice little opener for german tv show
Smokin opener to Summer tour.  Great mid jam.  Great Phil bombs throughout.

performances.venue: Fillmore East New York City, NY
performances.description: Best show of 71, every song should be in here, and I love these early Berthas, they have a wild flyin spirit...
Speedy late 70's precision. Hot relic from a sweet run. (also, trying to add 7.4.89 and keep getting an error message. Version needs recognition)
Jery gives it a little extra, and Weir is slashing some real gorgeousness
Phil + Phil = One of the best ever!!
A rocking Bertha to end the first set.
Bob's playing SHINES on this one with a little help of course. Jer's lead' is a paint peeler.

performances.venue: Oakland-Alameda County Coliseum Arena Oakland, CA

performances.description: Nice and smoking opener to set two had the crowd up and dancing, nicely sung by Jerry.

performances.venue: Moody Coliseum - Southern Methodist University Dallas, TX
performances.description: If a better board of this show had been circulating, this Bertha would be so much higher, and right into one of the best Good Lovins ever, Fall 77
A hot one for sure.
Jerry plays the solo with conviction

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: Energetic, smoking, and glue. Naturally tight, the click is unmistakable. The AUD is like an SBD, quality A.
Clean clean Bertha opener with hot middle jam!

performances.venue: Greek Theatre, U. Of California Berkeley, CA
performances.description: Great energy and vocals
Yeah - nice little boogie to open the show.

performances.venue: Texas Christian University Fort Worth, TX
performances.description: The jam in this take blazes hotter than most any other - Jer throws an Eww!  in there for good measure.
Jerry on his giddy up and RIDE for this show opener.
Warp speed, precise, slightly unhinged, and driving into the greenish-blue evening.
Garcia pierces the ears and sets on fire the sold out Philly Spectrum on HOT post coma East Coast comeback tour. This Bertha is HOTT
A brisk, breathtaking version. The band is firing on all cylinders and having a great time.
Ripping and great. Also too add, show contains best Black Peter ever IMHO.
Phil and Bobby are really on for this one..

performances.venue: Thompson Arena - Dartmouth College Hanover, NH
performances.description: Playfully different melody here really cool Jer is sporting very catchy phrasing - mid tempo no hurry super chill with highlights.
Masterclass from the Philzone here.  He tears this one up.
tight vocals and uniform '73 playing
I always liked the late-second-set placement of Bertha in the early Brent era. This one smokes - Brent's keys are fiery and Jerry destroys the solo.
crystal clear solo

performances.venue: Campus Stadium - University Of California Santa Barbara, CA
performances.description: A great Bertha->Good Lovin'
Short and sweet with lots of character.  This show has mix / sound issues, but is quite worth the listen.
Great Version of a Great Song, from a Great Month in '77
The only show I ever attended.  Luckily it was a great one.  Hornsby shines on this one.
Speedy, raunchy and rocking&rolling ....Jer with a feeling right here.
I remember this run as a lot of fun and well played.  The bertha first set closer was fun as hell and a nice surprise.
A bouncy second set opener that goes straight into the greatest Stephen Ever Played
great vocals on a straightforward, charging version
You Gotta be KIDDING ME!! I came here to vote for this totally awesome Bertha and it's not even listed yet? This Bertha Made Peace in the Middle East!
Bertha on steroids! The boys knock this one out. First show without Mickey, appears on 3 from the vault.
Unknown Genre - iTunes. Kreutzmann drives this hovercraft - as he seems to in all of the great Berthas of this time. Look out for the guitars.
Nice show opener from Dave's Picks 38
Believe it or not it's all workin
Just Exactly Perfect
Hotness
I love these early versions with Brent.
Phil gets this one going, and Jerry knows just what to do with it.

performances.venue: Oakland-Alameda County Coliseum Stadium Oakland, CA
performances.description: Love this Bertha in the ballad slot.  Kick ass Bertha!

performances.venue: Buckeye Lake Music Center Hebron, OH
performances.description: Ran into a rainstorm place went nuts
show opener

performances.venue: Pine Knob Music Theater Clarkston, MI
performances.description: Another one that really benefits from the post space set 2 energey really rocks into an also hot good lovin

performances.venue: Lusk Field House - State University Of New York Cortland, NY
performances.description: Wonderful bouncy version with loads of Phil
Rock and swing right here - love this combo great Weir work, Jer on point, Snakey Phil and Keith's awake with Billy driving the kit.
Not nearly enough love for this show.
Betty Board
Absolutely Ripping version, Jerry's solos are jaunty, cryptic,and incredibly dynamic.  Can't recall ever hearing a Bertha sound like this before!!!

performances.venue: Oklahoma City Music Hall Oklahoma City, OK
performances.description: Packs that '72 Punch
Unique bounce to this one...slower than usual for '74, but still neat.
Classic 1972 rip of this one, feels straight out of Europe. Underrated rip from an Underrated show! AWEOME JERRY LEADS!!!!

performances.venue: Terminal Island Correctional Facility San Pedro, CA
performances.description: Playin it up for the prisoners and the Bear
Killer Promised Land->Bertha->Greatest Story Ever Told.
A groovin and a movin' '93 Bertha->Good Lovin'.
If you don't know this one, check it out.
Dick's Picks 24 version.

performances.venue: Indianapolis State Fair Coliseum Indianapolis, IN
performances.description: Great solos, tight ensemble playing kicking of the 2nd set from a great show. Energetic and blazing.

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: Okay, so maybe Garcia drops some words (& even verses) here and there...it gives him an opportunity for an extra long solo, which winds around nicely.
Extended and ripping. Tape has a few sound issues, but its listenable. Sick version.

performances.venue: Yale Bowl, Yale University New Haven, CT
performances.description: Revs up the rowdy crowd, tight and powerful 2nd set opener in a brilliant show. The AUD is a bit rough in places, but gives it great atmosphere.  Hot.
Soulful, melodic soloing, with Phil interweaving with bombs. On the AUD (Charlie Miller) Phil is clearly audible, its thunder. Certified grade A.

performances.venue: Greek Theatre, U. Of California Berkeley, CA
performances.description: Smoking set closer with intense build up to "test me, test me". Great late period gem.
Hi energy foot stomping opener to a very high energy show. Full speed ahead full throttle version.

performances.venue: East Hall, Franklin & Marshall College Lancaster, PA
performances.description: fantastic swinging rocker of a bertha very excellent, love how Jerry stretches out the vocals this is some great shit right here
Punchy with some heat. Pigs tone on the pipe organ(?) or electric piano makes this special too. Source:CM
How can this one not be on here? This is what early Bertha should sound like! Check out Billy K...
High energy start to a great show. In fact a great run at the Berkley. Good vocals
Love how this one starts Phil up in the mix and then Jer gets rawish at the end...
Spring '71 - you already know it's real good.

performances.venue: Barton Hall - Cornell University Ithaca, NY
performances.description: Big ol' bucket of extra crispy Bertha - kicks ass.
Get down and boogie.

performances.venue: Carrier Dome, Syracuse U Syracuse, NY
performances.description: Lift off during Jerry's solo - maybe some celebratory barkers too before the show.
A few flubs at the start, but they make up for it by playing for their life afterwards, crazy intensity
Not the all-time best but surely deserves to be on the list

performances.venue: Cameron Indoor Stadium, Duke U Durham, NC
performances.description: One of the very best of the era

Great Version

performances.venue: Oakland-Alameda County Coliseum Arena Oakland, CA
performances.description: Heater.  Great start to the show

performances.venue: Robert F. Kennedy Stadium Washington, DC
performances.description: Money

performances.venue: Golden Hall, Community Concourse San Diego, CA

performances.description: A ripping version from a ripping show
Nice flowing, dream-like solo from Jerry in this one.  Very nice
Just a full-on rocking get-up-and-jump version. Keith's blazes here.

performances.venue: Kansas City Municipal Auditorium Arena Kansas City, MO
performances.description: Minglewood>Bertha>Dancin'...................I'll take that anytime!!!!
An awesomely unique solo; minor flub, but no matter! Smoking version!!
Not good but Jerry's first "Why don't you arrest me?!?" after his bust. He delights in it.
nice leads on a romp out of DS

Listen closely and you can hear exactly where April '71 becomes legendary.

performances.venue: Iowa State Fairgrounds Des Moines, IA
performances.description: The bass cut at the start of this is a tragedy. Still a great version.
Whole show is heady, deserves more love
Leaning against the rail watching from 12 feet away, it was the greatest song I'd ever seen ANY band play. Slick solo.
Very bright bouncy later era version.
Love the few rare post space versions, love the ripping rock n roll towards the end of a show and Jerry rips this
I can not get enough of these post space Bertha's. Ripping rocking a pleasure to hear
Killer LTGTR>Bertha...they keep the energy going from the prior night!
VERY VERY high energy ripper, Jerry's notes are just piercing on this evenings version. Sweet rocking transition into Good Lovin, Phil just nails it!
Underrated

performances.venue: Oklahoma City Music Hall Oklahoma City, OK
performances.description: Classic '72 Bertha
Hot high energy opener!

performances.venue: Saratoga Performing Arts Center Saratoga Springs, NY
performances.description: One of my favorite versions. When they open with a Bertha like this, you know you're in for a hell of a ride.

performances.venue: Onondaga County War Memorial Syracuse, NY
performances.description: I really like this one. Cool tempo and nice vocals

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY

performances.venue: Fillmore East New York City, NY
performances.description: Best show of 71, every song should be in here, and I love these early Berthas, they have a wild flyin spirit...

performances.venue: St. Paul Civic Center St. Paul, MN
performances.description: Man, this version cooks. Awesome way to open the show.

performances.venue: Cumberland County Civic Center Portland, ME
performances.description: Excellent energy and Jerry led jamming to start a smoking show
An energetic, well mixed 71Bertha that's been missed somehow. Keth had been in the band for only a month but already fitting in very well.
Fiery version - Jerry is ON. Mothership on hype. Worthy of a focused spin
Hot show opener from an extremely underrated show

performances.venue: Long Beach Arena Long Beach, CA
performances.description: Ripping opener of an outstanding three-night run. Jerry on fire.
What is this, chopped liver?
How is this one not on here? Great fills by Keith.
Excellent show opening Bertha.  Surprised it's not on here.
I LOVE this version.  Jerry hits some goodness here.  So hot

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY

performances.description: A great version of Bertha->Jack Straw.
Jerry's 1st east coast version since the bust.  Starts mellow but the drummers build a unique groove.  Jerry's obviously motivated to build this 1.

performances.venue: Felt Forum - Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: Phil plays some really unique notes in this one

absolutely smoking show i dig this whole performance

performances.venue: Curtis Hixon Convention Hall Tampa, FL
performances.description: Great version, very energetic and perfectly executed.  Easily overlooked and overshadowed by the rest of this amazing show.

performances.venue: Wallace Wade Stadium, Duke University Durham, NC
performances.description: So damn fat and chunky...
set 2 ender, nice rocking post space,-bp. a truly legendary night

Rambles and rumbles along with the exuberant, teaming masses

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY

performances.description: Yep the old cliche "I can't believe this one's not here yet" This Bertha Flipping ROCKS People!!! Killer Flow and Solo.

Kicks off this epic set 2. Great version, Jerry's torching it.
Great opening of the show

performances.venue: Curtis Hixon Convention Center Tampa, FL
performances.description: Great take, and the new source carries the aud well

performances.venue: Spartan Stadium - San Jose State University San Jose, CA
performances.description: Out of an excellent Miracle 2nd set opener.
Just really nice man.
Phil bombs from the get-go. Jerry in the zone. Take a listen.

Perfect opener

performances.description: Blazing Jerr fire…!

performances.venue: Veterans' Memorial Coliseum New Haven, CT
performances.description: This Bertha cooks.  Definately deserves to be here.  Jerry forgets the last verse, but the less Jerry sings, the more Jerry plays.

performances.venue: Davis Gym, Bucknell University Lewisburg, PA
performances.description: Nailed it. Part of the great April run that coalesces the '71 sound. Killing 1st set with manageable mix and saturation issues.
excellent groove absolutely a superior version top shelf
This one has to be on this list. A glorious Day at Cal Expo!

performances.venue: Northrop Auditorium, U. of Minn. Minneapolis, MN
performances.description: Rippin' Energy
Charging strong out of the gate with this awesome rocker to open the show.
A soaring melody from Jerry.
Swifty rocker to open the show.
Show stopper Version... Jerry muffs the vocals.So what. Then does it a few more times. But you will dance from beginning to end

performances.venue: Golden Hall, Community Concourse San Diego, CA
performances.description: Funky intro by Jer.  Nice meandering mid jam with some nice Phil bombs.
A neighbor of the Skull & Roses version, it's got that early '71 band-of-5 bounce
Turn sunburst orange, blue, and white all over again
Solid opening version.

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: Great crowd response
Phil's all over this one. Really urgent upbeat version.

performances.venue: Camp Randall Field House Madison, WI
performances.description: At :30 Pig switches from tambourine to organ and we're off! These early '71 performances showcase Kreutzmann reveling in sweet space. Driving.

performances.venue: Academy of Music New York, NY
performances.description: Thumping Phil, driving Billy, SUBLIME Bobby work, Jerry drops a quick solo - sometimes it not always about Jerry’s jam - even tho it is ;)
Hello, Maine!

performances.venue: Iowa State Fairgrounds Des Moines, IA
performances.description: Slower tempo gives room to move; Phil especially active
Sneaky, searching solo is worth a listen.
Thanks to George Prescott in Deadbase 50 for pointing this out. What a sublime solo, despite average sound quality.
Builds into a ripper, the boys love Manor Downs!
There's some intentional stutters in the solo that the whole band picks up on and its magical. On fire, not sure how this wasn't already here
Very hot version, Jerry’s on fire in the solo and his vocals are perfect. This show is massively underrated vs much of the rest of this fall tour.
The alaska shows were really amazing
2nd set, after space>miracle!! Full of groove and chaw. yet another tune that the brent years did CPR on.
The new DaP release showcases how good this, especially w/Keith way up front in the mix & kicking the tune into ragtime jazz gear-a fantastic version!

Still brand new.  This just pops and crackles with energy.  Great fun.

Great early version of Bertha, so cool to hear Crosby on vocals.

a beautiful show opener under the pyramids

whoa can't believe I'm submitting a Bertha. Very cool. Band sounds great
